TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CloudPool extends System.Object implements class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IInheritedBehaviors, class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IRefreshable

Docs.summary: A pool in the Azure Batch service.
Gets an which indicates what node allocation activity is occurring on the pool.
Gets the time at which the pool entered its current .
Gets or sets the list of application licenses the Batch service will make available on each compute node in the pool.
Docs.remarks: The list of application licenses must be a subset of available Batch service application licenses.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a list of application packages to be installed on each compute node in the pool.
Gets or sets whether the pool size should automatically adjust according to the .

remarks.para: If true, the property is required, the pool automatically resizes according to the formula, and and must be null.
If false, one of the or properties is required.
The default value is false.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a time interval at which to automatically adjust the pool size according to the .
Docs.remarks: The default value is 15 minutes. The minimum allowed value is 5 minutes.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a formula for the desired number of compute nodes in the pool.

remarks.para: For how to write autoscale formulas, see https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/batch-automatic-scaling/. This property is required if is set to true. It must be null if AutoScaleEnabled is false.
The formula is checked for validity before the pool is created. If the formula is not valid, an exception is thrown when you try to commit the .

Docs.summary: Gets the results and errors from the last execution of the .
Gets or sets a list of certificates to be installed on each compute node in the pool.

MemberSignature.Value: public void ChangeOSVersion (string targetOSVersion, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors = null);

.method public hidebysig instance void ChangeOSVersion(string targetOSVersion, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors) cil managed

Docs.param: The Azure Guest OS version to be installed on the virtual machines in the pool.
A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .
Docs.summary: Changes the operating system version of this pool.

remarks.para: During the change OS version operation, the Batch service traverses the nodes of the pool, changing the OS version of compute nodes. When a compute node is chosen, any tasks running on that node are removed from the node and requeued to be rerun later (or on a different compute node). The node will be unavailable until the version change is complete.

The operation will result in temporarily reduced pool capacity as nodes are taken out of service to have their OS version changed. Although the Batch service tries to avoid changing all compute nodes at the same time, it does not guarantee to do this (particularly on small pools); therefore, the operation may result in the pool being temporarily unavailable to run tasks.
When you request an OS version change, the pool state changes to . When all compute nodes have finished changing version, the pool state returns to .

While the version change is in progress, the pool's reflects the OS version that nodes are changing from, and reflects the OS version that nodes are changing to. Once the change is complete, CurrentOSVersion is updated to reflect the OS version now running on all nodes.
This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see .

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task ChangeOSVersionAsync (string targetOSVersion, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors = null, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken = null);

.method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task ChangeOSVersionAsync(string targetOSVersion, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed

Docs.param: The Azure Guest OS version to be installed on the virtual machines in the pool.
A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .
A for controlling the lifetime of the asynchronous operation.
Docs.summary: Changes the operating system version of this pool.
Docs.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.

remarks.para: During the change OS version operation, the Batch service traverses the nodes of the pool, changing the OS version of compute nodes. When a compute node is chosen, any tasks running on that node are removed from the node and requeued to be rerun later (or on a different compute node). The node will be unavailable until the version change is complete.

The operation will result in temporarily reduced pool capacity as nodes are taken out of service to have their OS version changed. Although the Batch service tries to avoid changing all compute nodes at the same time, it does not guarantee to do this (particularly on small pools); therefore, the operation may result in the pool being temporarily unavailable to run tasks.
When you request an OS version change, the pool state changes to . When all compute nodes have finished changing version, the pool state returns to .

While the version change is in progress, the pool's reflects the OS version that nodes are changing from, and reflects the OS version that nodes are changing to. Once the change is complete, CurrentOSVersion is updated to reflect the OS version now running on all nodes.
The change version operation runs asynchronously.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the for the pool.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void CommitChanges(class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors) cil managed

Docs.param: A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .
Docs.summary: Commits all pending changes to this to the Azure Batch service.

remarks.para: Updates an existing on the Batch service by replacing its properties with the properties of this which have been changed. Unchanged properties are ignored. All changes since the last time this entity was retrieved from the Batch service (either via , , or ) are applied. Properties which are explicitly set to null will cause an exception because the Batch service does not support partial updates which set a property to null. If you need to set a property to null, use the method.
This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see .

Docs.summary: Gets the creation time for the pool.
This property is an alias for and is supported only for backward compatibility.
Gets the number of dedicated compute nodes currently in the pool.
Gets the number of low-priority compute nodes currently in the pool.
Docs.remarks: Low-priority compute nodes which have been preempted are included in this count.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a list of behaviors that modify or customize requests to the Batch service made via this .

remarks.para: These behaviors are inherited by child objects.
Modifications are applied in the order of the collection. The last write wins.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Delete(class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors) cil managed

Docs.param: A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .
Docs.summary: Deletes this pool.

remarks.para: The delete operation requests that the pool be deleted. The request puts the pool in the state. The Batch service will requeue any running tasks and perform the actual pool deletion without any further client action.
remarks.remarks: This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the id of the pool.
Gets or sets whether the pool permits direct communication between its compute nodes.

Docs.param: A used for filtering the list and for controlling which properties are retrieved from the service.
A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the and .
Docs.summary: Enumerates the compute nodes of this pool.
Docs.returns: An that can be used to enumerate compute nodes asynchronously or synchronously.
Docs.remarks: This method returns immediately; the nodes are retrieved from the Batch service only when the collection is enumerated. Retrieval is non-atomic; nodes are retrieved in pages during enumeration of the collection.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of tasks that can run concurrently on a single compute node in the pool.
Docs.remarks: The default value is 1. The maximum value of this setting depends on the size of the compute nodes in the pool (the property).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a list of name-value pairs associated with the pool as metadata.
Gets or sets the network configuration of the pool.

Docs.param: The to remove from the pool.
Specifies how to handle tasks already running, and when the nodes running them may be removed from the pool. The default is .
Specifies the timeout for removal of compute nodes from the pool. The default value is 15 minutes. The minimum value is 5 minutes.
A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .
Docs.summary: Removes the specified compute node from this pool.

remarks.para: If you need to remove multiple compute nodes from a pool, it is more efficient to use the overload.
You can only remove nodes from a pool when the of the pool is . If the pool is already resizing, an exception occurs.
When you remove nodes from a pool, the pool's changes from to .
This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see .

MemberSignature.Value: public void Resize (int targetDedicated, Nullable<TimeSpan> resizeTimeout = null, Nullable<Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeDeallocationOption> deallocationOption = null, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors = null);

.method public hidebysig instance void Resize(int32 targetDedicated, valuetype System.Nullable`1<valuetype System.TimeSpan> resizeTimeout, valuetype System.Nullable`1<valuetype Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeDeallocationOption> deallocationOption, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors) cil managed

Docs.param: The desired number of compute nodes in the pool.

The timeout for allocation of compute nodes to the pool or removal of compute nodes from the pool. If the pool has not reached the target size after this time, the resize is stopped. The default is 15 minutes.
Specifies when nodes may be removed from the pool, if the pool size is decreasing. The default is .
A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .
Docs.summary: Resizes this pool.

remarks.para: The resize operation requests that the pool be resized. The request puts the pool in the allocation state. The Batch service will perform the actual resize without any further client action, and set the allocation state to once complete.

You can only resize a pool when its is . You cannot resize pools which are configured for automatic scaling (that is, the property of the pool is true). If you decrease the pool size, the Batch service chooses which nodes to remove. To remove specific nodes, call .
This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see .

Docs.param: The desired number of dedicated compute nodes in the pool. At least one of and is required.
The desired number of low-priority compute nodes in the pool. At least one of and is required.

The timeout for allocation of compute nodes to the pool or removal of compute nodes from the pool. If the pool has not reached the target size after this time, the resize is stopped. The default is 15 minutes.
Specifies how to handle tasks already running, and when the nodes running them may be removed from the pool, if the pool size is decreasing. The default is .
A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .

Docs.summary: Resizes this pool.
Docs.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.

remarks.para: The resize operation requests that the pool be resized. The request puts the pool in the allocation state. The Batch service will perform the actual resize without any further client action, and set the allocation state to once complete.

You can only resize a pool when its is . You cannot resize pools which are configured for automatic scaling (that is, the property of the pool is true). If you decrease the pool size, the Batch service chooses which nodes to remove. To remove specific nodes, call .
The resize operation runs asynchronously.

Docs.summary: Gets the resize error encountered while performing the last resize on the . This error is returned only when the Batch service encountered an error while resizing the pool, and when the pool's is Steady.

Gets a list of errors encountered while performing the last resize on the . Errors are returned only when the Batch service encountered an error while resizing the pool, and when the pool's is Steady.
Gets or sets the timeout for allocation of compute nodes to the pool.
Gets or sets a task to run on each compute node as it joins the pool. The task runs when the node is added to the pool or when the node is restarted.
Gets the current state of the pool.
Gets the time at which the pool entered its current state.
Gets the resource usage statistics for the pool.
Docs.remarks: This property is populated only if the was retrieved with an including the 'stats' attribute; otherwise it is null.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void StopResize(class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors) cil managed

Docs.param: A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .
Docs.summary: Stops a resize operation on this pool.
Docs.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.

remarks.para: This operation stops an ongoing resize operation on the pool. The pool size will stabilize at the number of nodes it is at when the stop operation is done. During the stop operation, the pool changes first to and then to .
This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see .

The stop resize operation runs asynchronously.

Docs.summary: This property is an alias for and is supported only for backward compatibility.
Docs.remarks: This property must be null if is set to true. It is required if AutoScaleEnabled is set to false.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the desired number of dedicated compute nodes in the pool.
Docs.remarks: This setting cannot be specified if is set to true. At least one of this property and must be specified if is false. If not specified, the default is 0.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the desired number of low-priority compute nodes in the pool.
Docs.remarks: This setting cannot be specified if is set to true. At least one of and this property must be specified if is false. If not specified, the default is 0.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets how tasks are distributed among compute nodes in the pool.
Gets the URL of the pool.
Gets or sets the list of user accounts to be created on each node in the pool.
Gets or sets the of the pool.
Gets or sets the size of the virtual machines in the pool. All virtual machines in a pool are the same size.

remarks.para: For information about available sizes of virtual machines for Cloud Services pools (pools created with a ), see https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/cloud-services-sizes-specs/. Batch supports all Cloud Services VM sizes except ExtraSmall.

For information about available VM sizes for pools using images from the Virtual Machines Marketplace (pools created with a ) see https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/virtual-machines-linux-sizes/ or https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/virtual-machines-windows-sizes/. Batch supports all Azure VM sizes except STANDARD_A0 and those with premium storage (for example STANDARD_GS, STANDARD_DS, and STANDARD_DSV2 series).
